intro: Mellissia, commonly known as the honeyflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. Mellissia species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value and others for their medicinal properties.
